transcript.content: Foo Fighters "All My Life" on Xfm 104.9. I'm Ricky Gervais with me Steve Merchant…
…and of course Karl Pilkington. Oooooo have we got a show for you today.
What have we got planned, what have we got planned?
Loads of stuff and it- two hours of it.
Specifically what sort of stuff have you planned for us? Cause I know you've been working hard.
What have you done what have you done?
Cause I see oh you know I've been busy this week I've been house hunting I've had various things but I know you've had the whole week off.
So what have you been up to?
Go on then, Karl. Karl, tell him what we've got. Tell him what you've- what we've planned and all the stuff you've done.
But Rick, Specifically what have you come up with?
Quick quick quick quick cause people are gettin' bored. Tell us what you've-
Ok, I've come up with um the music.
Right, I c- obviously that- we've already planned that. We planned that last week, so that's all done. But what have you yourself contributed to today's show?
I got uh- I got uh… um… uh… a text message today from Ross Noble. You know, Ross Noble the comedian.
Who's on- who's on Have I Got News For You.
Alright? He says, "Ask Karl, if he woke up with ladies' boobs would he just put a dress on and live as a lady or would he just be a man but with these boobs?"
I know, I know that happened to Ross.
So he's throwing that one out at ya.
He did in a way cause he ate pizzas for a year, didn't he?
He got a lovely pair of breasts.
Probably just find a loose fitting jumper and go to the doctors
What would you say to the doctor? How would you explain this phenomenon to the doctor? See you'd be- you'd be happy with this cause you believe in um- shite like you know-
But it can happen cos I told ya a couple of weeks ago how that can happen.
How you can wake up with breasts if you're a fella. I told ya.
No I I I funny that, innit? Go on.
No I I don't remember this. Wh- did you tell us on air?
Yeah. Um it can happen if you go to Argentina and have a steak…
… you can wake up with breasts. Because-
I'm sure I would have remembered that.
Look'it he likes that he likes that!
Is that what you’ve come up with for this week, that joke?
Brilliant play a record it's gonna be a dynamite show.
Oh right listen, look we're gonna play- I'm gonna play some classic tunes today I'm gonna educate the youngsters, Steve.
Right, now you've all heard of Lou Reed, you've all heard of Velvet Underground but, you know, have you heard of "Venus in Furs", Karl?
Ricky and Steve sing "Shiny boots of leather"
The Velvet Underground - Venus in Furs
"Venus in Furs" Velvet Underground. What a great start. A classic song.
I mean they continue to sound fresh and contemporary.
Yeah. Is this- do you know what that s-song's about, Karl?
Bout plush and all that, all the things you can get at Marks and Spencers.
Yeah, I think that's a new division they've opened.
Yeah. But we have got a great show lined up.
No no we have cause we've got um- uh- Rockbusters, coming up the great quiz.
And that- that's- that's made the press.
Yeahyeahyeahyeahyeahyeahyeah, um- uh- Friendly Tearooms Newsletter mentioned it.

Yeah, yeah we've also got uh Educating Ricky where Karl educates me. The one last week, (in a Manc accent) A girl, right, she was deaf and she's had an argument with her mum, she pushed her and she hit her head and then she could hear again.
Don't know what I learned from that.
It might be- it might be subliminal- summat might be going- it might be a metaphor that I will learn from.
Yeah yeah so uh- look at his face.
We might as well have been talking Dutch. Mightn't we, Karl?
D-d- I don't understand what you want from me.
Alright so… Educating Ricky, I've worked a bit harder this week, got some good stuff.
Uh- I'll give you the- the- the-
So you've got- you've got Rockbusters as well.
Karl's having a bit of a stressful week cause he thinks he's not appreciated, cause he- he- he gets in at- what time you gettin' in, about 8 or 9 don't ya?
About… well last w- well yeah I've been busy this week, I've been in about half past 8 in the morning.
About half past 8 or 9:00 at night.
I'm busy at home at the moment.
A lot of people work late, Karl. A lot of people work 12 hour days.
Why are you busy at home, Karl? What you up to?
Cos we're tryin' to sort out a move.
I've been tryin' to call around this morning to get someone to buy a futon and a table from me.
Well we could put that appeal out now, couldn't we, if anyone wants to buy a futon or a table?
Just think a futon that Karl Pilkington slept on.
Exactly. How much are you uh- you asking?
Well you need to be more specific.
You gotta take the two, I don't want, like, different people coming round an' that.
Gotta buy futon and a table, um-
It's quite specific, isn't it? If someone has to want a futon the-
The specific futon you're selling and the table.
And the tea mate, isn't it. Alarm clock and teamaker this is futon and table.
Lookin' for about- about a hundred quid.
And it's good to- it's good condition, the futon?
Right no stains, you haven't pissed yourself in the- no.
No, nothing? And what kind of table, what sort of table is it we're talking? Are we talking like a table for a lounge, a d- dining table?
No, f- for uh- like a computer and uh- uh just uh- you know something-
Have you got any drawers? Are there any drawers?
No it's just a nice wooden table and uh- solid-
Is it- is it kind of oak or is it sort of an Ikea sort of thing?
The futon is just- is just a mattress and the- and the- the- the pallets, yeah?
Yeah but it's not- you see, you get cheap futons don't you.
So this is a good one is it-
This is a good one it's- it's uh-
How much would that have retailed for when you purchased it?
I think I paid about 250 for it.
So it's a bargain for people?
Well, if you look at it, if you-
Now how long have you had it, how old- how old is it?
This is a whole new strand, isn't it?
Well, I think it- I this is-
I don't thing it's legal, I think- I don't think we should use-
I'll tell you what I'm interested in, Rick is-
-just finding out a little bit about the sort of thing that Karl's got in his home, you know?
I- I'm interested in if people will phone up to spend a hundred pounds just to go round-
No no I won't be, no.
No no they come here I'll bring it to work and they can pick it up here.
You're gonna bring a futon and a table to work? Don't you ride a bike to work?
So hold on we need someone with a van, now.
So we need- is- is anyone who wants to- they're not allowed round your house, can they meet you next door, someone with a van who will-
Can they meet you in your street somewhere?
Hold on, could they meet you, hold on what about the little Chinese fella that lives across the road, on the 2 houses and the old woman who's dead reading a book? Could- could you meet him somewhere-
I've got an idea, what about if you meet them at the end of your street, you blindfold them-
Like they do when- when terrorists take the negotiator to the uh-
And um- and so you can do that and in- and so, you know they- they could piece together, maybe where you live.
But, uh- what about that, Karl? That’s- that's just a great idea.
And would you sign the futon for people, d'you think? Would you uh- would you give 'em a little signature? Or maybe you could-
Or maybe you could sign the pallet, you could sign the pallet.
Yeah, or I could try and get work to buy it off me and then we give it away for Rockbusters.
Do you think they'd do that? You think they'd do that? They'd probably do it for Foxy with his- with his big hog.
Imagine how big that would be.
Imagine if he wanted to sell his hog.
Yeah. That is a motorbike isn't it? I-
Yeah, he's been selling his hog for money for years doesn't he?
So, but we'll see about that if people are interested.
So uh- if people are interested then maybe email um- [email protected] if you're interested in a futon.
What gear have we got in here?
I never knew what that meant, O-N-O, I don't- I thought it meant sort of on the nose, on the noooose.
Oh that's good, yeah. Um- what have we got well tell 'em what we've got we've got to give away Steve.
Actually I have to say you've excelled yourself this week.
And we got Richard Ashcroft's single coming up soon after this, go on.
When have you- since when have you taken to talking like that?
Um- this is actually- this is a nice little collection here, this is a 3 DVD set uh- David Attenborough's uh- The Life of Birds: Trials of Life and Life in the Free Zone.
That's a good one, innit? Go on.
That's a selection of- uh- animal-based documentaries.
I hate when he goes off for boar and he does like uh- fast cars.
This is uh- a very very good indeed, this is uh- uh- a best of David Bowie compilation
It is a very good- it's a proper one-
Not the rubbish ones that no one else wanted this is a brilliant compilation of Bowie.

Yes it's got an excellent selection on there. Uh- we've got- what's this? Now this looks like a Madness… oh no, no no no no no, no it's far worse than we could have possibly imagined, it seems to be some kind of-
-tie in with the Our House Madness musical.
And it's sort of what a cast of 20 people who wanted to be singers?
Uh- I ca- it's tricky to find out I can't figure out if it's the originals or not but needless to say if you're a Madness fan I'm sure that will be an absolute treat.
Yeahyeahyeah, you'll love that you'll love that.
Uh- now I know that uh-
Steve, I wouldn't mind that DVD collection meself.
I can't- we can't give it away, no we can't.
Talking of great compilations what about this is Country Legends
I'm seeing on there Glen Campbell we've got Dolly Parton we've got um- whatchamacallit on the- on the cover.
Great hits from him so uh- that's there-
That's uh some Xfm compilation again easy to get hold of if you-
But the big one, the big one the film that Karl uh- picks every week.
Don't go out tonight if you've got a DVD player and a television set cause you'll be staying in and watching this fantastic film.
It will tear your soul apart. It's Hellraiser.

The original Hellraiser, bear in mind it has been on Channel 4 and Channel 5 and on most cable channels since it came out. But if you haven't seen it- if you are one of the only people who has not seen it and of course you have to be over 18 to play, then you can win Hellraiser.
That is fantastic well uh- play a- play a song, Karl and we'll come back to that, more- more great stuff.
Indeed the competition coming up later. Email only isn't it, Karl?
Richard Ashcroft "Check the Meaning." Well, Karl you're chuffed aren't ya? What's happened? What's just happened? Tell the listeners what's happened.
This has sparked you up a bit.
Steve's just called up, he's uh- put in an offer for the futon and the table.
Um- I think he wanted to- he definitely wanted it but I said, "Look, now think about it over the weekend."
No well I'm no- I'm not gonna rush him into it because once he's got it he- he can't bring it back. I'm not messin' about.
The bloke said uh- "What sort of wood is it?" Karl said, "Sort of uh- sort of like a light brown color." He went, "What, beech colored?" Karl went, "Depends what beach you're on."
You do understand there's a wood that's called beech.
Uh- well- well he's- he's happy he likes the sound of it and I had a plum cover.
Yeah. Is Karl going, "That will go with (mumbles)" he's just going, "I'll tell you what'll look nice in your spare bedroom…" It was like a-
-an episode of Changing Rooms it was like listening to a representative Karl
He did the deal in under 3 minutes wasn't it?
You phoned him about half way through in that song so-
You work pretty quick, Karl, I've gotta say.
I'm sure we're not allowed to do this, though.
No I think it's highly criminal.
Well I tell you I am moving shortly so I mean I might- I might come in next week I could have a couple of things.
I threw away a desk the other day.

I've gotta get rid of a bed, um- a chair, cause you know I'm pretty tall. This is so pathetic. When I- when I moved up to London my dad said, "Well you wanna be careful cause I mean the seating in a lot of these London pads it's a bad scene, very low backs. Fashionable isn't it, fashionable chairs and stuff you're a big guy, 6 foot 7 you need, like, a decent chair." We went into a shop, it was, like, a second hand furniture shop, right? We bought this chair, very high backed.
What did you buy? The fact that you bought so low I love that.
It was just a chair so I could sit in my room and watch TV.
But was it a soft chair or was it a wooden chair?
It was kind of like a sort of uh- it was gr- lemme explain cause it's kind of like an armchair but it's kind of got wooden arms. So I get this chair I bring it up to London I'm-
And I'd be watching TV everyone else is in agony-
But I've got this lovely chair, right? And someone went- and they looked at it and they went, "Isn't that an orthopedic chair?"
And I looked at it again, right? And I realized it's kind of wipe cleanable.
It's made of some kind of fabric that allows you to just mop it down with a wet cloth.
Cause I think it came from an old people's home.
You know when you see, like, old people-
-in some kind of social room, it- at old people's homes just sat watching a little-
-cruddy old TV and they can- and you can wipe everything clean, it was- it's one of those chairs.
So if anyone's- maybe they've got an elderly relative.
(laughing) I just kept sliding off and it's also the most uncomfortable chair I've ever- cause unless you've got chronic back pain…
It just is pre- it's just the most uncomfortable chair. It makes you sit all upright-
You’ve done a good sell on it. I think uh- are the phones aren't going mental how much do you want for that, Steve?

If you've had a recent accident or you've got a disabled or- or um- or someone in the house who's just uh- elderly then um- maybe you might wanna get in touch. I'm happy to- you can tell that I'm out for 25 quid.
If you're setting up an old people's home
You know, it's a little pet project.
Yeah you don't get a lot of grant, you can have-
I mean um- because though Steve's such a high flier, I mean, if it really is a good cause he'll just give it to ya.
Let's not rush into anything, Rick. I like to assess each case individually.
Certainly, certainly if you are a charity then- then I might go for 20 quid, I can- you can take it off my hands for 20 quid.
Um- but otherwise 25 and I'll tell you-
-it is in good condition cause I haven't really sat on it.
5 quid off if you really are infirmed.
And there were some stains, I've wiped them clean.
Uh (laughing) yeah, yeah, uh- oh dear. Well that's fantastic so we've uh- we've uh-
Well let's- I'll tell you what we should resuscitate next week, Swap Shop, The Multicolored Swap Shop.
But there's a couple of things I've always wanted to get, Swap Shop is one of them and the other one is Superstars.

Superstars was great cause it was, like, the people of their time. So you'd have, like, people like- nowadays you'd have- you'd have Beckham and uh- uh- um- Whatshisname- uh- who's the tennis player? Who's it?

Yeah, (mumbles) and they- they have to compete. So all these people have to compete at each other's sports and they have to choose 7 out of 10 sports. And there's a leaderboard and there's a big final, oh Keegan came off his bike.
Jacks always used to win it
It's proper sports, it's 100 meters, tennis, weightlifting, all the real sports you- you can't do your own sport.
Well I know you're a pretty big uh- guy now in- in British TV. You're a bit of a big shot. What d'ya reckon, pull some strings?
Let's get it back on air.
Me, Johnny Vegas, Peter Kay- (high pitched) for the- for the- a bigger fella I think, maybe. The comedy- comedy superstars. Um- what we got next? We got a bit of Springsteen haven't we?
Let's play Springsteen. This is a track from his current album The Rise. A lot of people think…
…Bruce is a bit M-O-R, bit middle of the road or whatever, but, you know, I just think, piss off.
I just think, screw you. Just play it.
I just think- yeah. Get lost you.
Imagine this you're open top Caddy
You're just going around Route 66, you just, you goin' home maybe for Thanksgiving.
See your folks. Just turn up the radio if you are.
That just reminded me when I brought a- just stop it for a second. I just realized.
When I brought a girl back and she saw the orthopedic chair
When you bring a woman back to your pad, oh it's embarrassing.
Yeah and the (laughs). "Can you give me those two splints?" "I'm sorry?" "Those two splints, there." "Well I've got to go." "Have you?"
Is this a potty under the bed?
"The Rising" title track from Bruce Springsteen's current album, The Rising.

Great th- that feeling of s- it's melancholy and uplifting. We've had quite an interactive show so far cause we've got uh- a call that Superstars is coming back. It's due to come back in the BBC schedules, which is great new. Apparently Steve Redgrave is one of 'em. I just think will professional footballers be allowed to take part these days, though? Well not on 50 grand a week, you can't really have 'em falling off bikes and their… ankles.
Oh he fell over 3 times didn't he? Oh if it had- did you see Celebrity Fit Club?
There was a great moment where they had to go into the thing called a Bod Pod. And you sit in it, it looks quite space-age, and it- and it…

…analyzes you and it tells you percentage body fat. Now, I think um- men are meant to be about… sort of uh… 15-25% body fat. Women are meant to be like about 20-30 body fat. And they all went in there and um- they went in there and it said uh- Ian McCaskill came up…
uh… 34% body fat, or whatever: slightly overweight.
38%: overweight. Then it went um- that other one…
…um- uh- 45% body fat: obese. Then it went, Jono uh…
Did it say I don't want to tell you?
(laughing) yeah, yeah yeah and then it went uh-
50% body fat, um- uh- very obese. Then Rik Waller was sat in there and it came up 60% body fat and I wanted it to come up: slug.
and it came up morbidly- 60- you are 60% fat.
So- so 60% of him is fat?
Yeah. Yeah, yeah 60% of his entire makeup
Well, you know my feelings about Waller.
Well that's the reason I don't watch the show, actually.
I do feel a bit sorry for him and he is- he is tr- I think he is trying, although the fella there um- thinks he's not trying. So I don't know who to believe, Steve.
Do I believe Waller, and he does get pains an' that and he is a bit… you know.
The problem is, right, he does like his food.
Yeah. We- we all like our food.
But if he didn't do the exercise he wouldn't be as hungry… and he might not get fat.
This is a whole new nutritional outlook.
So you're saying, don't exercise and carry on eating and- that's interesting. Can I- no no no let me write that one down and we'll send that to the British-
Yeah, no that's good. Karl Pilkington, ok well- no no it's a- it's a good-
No, I'm no doctor or anything.
Oh come off it. Stop being so bloody modest.
Aren't ya? Aren't you a doctor, seriously? You- you didn't qualify? That's interesting.
I mean you- you're as good as a doctor you just- you just didn't get the paperwork or whatever. You just didn't turn up for the exam.
He was just saying that Bruce Springsteen um- uh- depressed him a little bit.

Cause it reminds him of when he worked in the supermarket and I went, "It's funny how a song can do that, take you right back there," and he went, "Yeah and nothing else can do that." I said, "Well actually smell is the most evocative sense cause smell is linked to memory in the brain." And he went, "Yeah, they probably said that before music though."
And now science is going, "Oh, we better revisit this, there's music now."
We've got this theory knocking around for, ya know, 10,000-
I went to see Bruce, you'll be pleased to know. I just want the fans of the show to know that I did make it to Bruce Springsteen's concert last week.

And uh- he started with that song we just played. And it was dynamite. I mean he never let up. Almost 3 hours, he rocked the joint. He's 53 he was sliding across- it was pure rock and roll. Pumping our fist, sliding across the floor on his knees, he was jumping on the piano. It was real Jerry Lee Lewis rock and roll and uh- it was dynamite. And um- I just was looking around though and when I am the trendiest person at a gig…
… then I'm in trouble. D'you know what I mean? And there was- some of the people there- I imagined, you know on Amazon.com um- it says like, "People who bought X also bought Y."
And I think people who bought tickets to Bruce probably bought tickets for Mark Knopfler.
Of Pink Floyd without Pink Floyd.
But there's also- yeah, but then there's also, you know, all the monsters of rock. They probably buy Stones when they visit, you know.
You know, it's the small waistcoats.
Plaid- plaid shirt maybe sort of like Timberlands. Nothing wrong with Timberlands. Oh that's libelous.
No, see I've done it again.

But uh- it was hell getting out, I couldn't fi- I mean I went to the tube and it was a nightmare cause some of the tubes weren't running. I just said to my friend, "Oh sod this," you know dadadada, stormed off trying to find a cab. Couldn't find a cab, wandering around Wembley just livid. I mean, fuming cause I couldn't find a cab. Just- I was screaming cause I was going, "I've got money, I'm on the radio, I've had a TV show. I've got the cash, I'm willing to spend it. There's no one who can help me get home."
I've seen- I've seen him shout this in Brewer Street.
Just standing in the middle. Go on.

And I was thinking to myself, what would you have done there? Because in the end I just sat in a little café and had something to eat. But you, I mean if you couldn't get a cab what would you have done? Just cause there's a couple of- I was looking there was a couple of hotels near Wembley. I was thinking you'd have just checked in.
Yeah. When there's a cab, let me know.
I was thinking, cause you were thinking of going, would you have booked a cab beforehand?
Would you have- would you have thought to do that?
Yeah, I'd have got a cab there and I'd have booked a cab somewhere.
Wouldn't the helicopters just took you back home?
Oh he's having a dig, isn't he?
He's having a laugh. Isn't he?
Featuring the voice of, is it Noel Gallagher?

Excellent, yeah. Right, ok, let's uh- let's get this show well and truly on the road. Um- we better start what Educating Ricky, next? Karl, what have you got for me? I can't wait for learning, I need learning, I need education.
-obviously, for those that have just tuned in. Karl, uh- tries to teach Ricky 3 things each week.
Each of them- just to tantalize Ricky, is um- abbreviated into some kind of headline.
A- a cryptic clue involved in a- involving a pun.
So what have you got for us this week?
Alright, they are really cryptic this week.
Um… first story, little headline is um… Don't worry about him, he candle it.
Sounds a bit like he can handle it but it's not. Brilliant.
Oh, Get a lobe of this.
And stark naked in Waterman's. Go on.
Second one. I'm Kermitted to this treatment.
Yeah. And the last one um… uh- the police are causing a bit of a stare.
(laughing) It's the way he looks when he says it. Oh I wish you could see it. Oh can't we get Karl on telly?
The- the- all the cable channels, anyone can get on telly these days. Let's get- let's-
-let's phone up. Let's get you on Choice or summat. Just a little- just Karl.
Wh- wh- wh- what you going for like?
Oh, he candle it. I think.
Don’t worry about him he candle it.
He candle it. Ok let's- let's hear this one.
Alright you familiar with the uh- the phrase burning the candle at both ends?
D'ya know how it's come about?
I know a man who does.
I- I assumed that it was to get more light… in the room.
Well, they'd put it sideways and light both wicks out of one candle they could get two-
No, what it is- it's uh-
I know what it means. It means you- you're staying- you're doing too much, you're staying up too much. You're not getting enough sleep and you're-
Um- when they didn't have light bulbs an' that.
Oh yeah, what year is this? Literally, literally ages ago, specifically.
Uh… didn't have light bulbs an' that so they used to have candles everywhere-
When did the light bulb come in cause I can't remember at the moment?
So um… yeah so there's no light bulb.
Well you wouldn't know anyway, you're a- you're a doctor you're not a historian. Go on.
Uh- and people who worked a lot of hours, yeah.
They get up early in the morning, cos they have to be up early.
And it's dark outside so they light the candle.
And they wear it out a bit. And then they- they're gettin' in late as well.

And like, they be like, "Oh, it's dark, we'll have to light the candle again." And they're burning candle at both ends of the day. So that's where the saying comes from burning the candle at both ends… So…
No, no you can't have another one yet.
You can't rush into them, Rick. You've got to-
You've gotta soak that one in. Any questions for Karl off the back of that?
So… so people were- I mean basically where this comes from is people have-
Literally burning the candle at both ends of the day.
-at both ends of the day, sure.
I'm Kermitted to this treatment and-
I can't wait, this is like- this is like Christmas Eve for me-
It's like I've got to open another present now.

No, I'm afraid we've gotta save it. But Rick, listen um- we often get a lot of email correspondence during the show, Rick uh- which I don't- I don’t sort of pass onto you cause I mean, you're busy, you're planning the show and stuff-
And you've got music and stuff to worry about

So I checked the emails and, we get a lot of response, a lot of people obviously- you know- wanna give us feedback. Uh- just a sample one um- from Richard Anderson, he's just uh- emailed us in here, Rick cause uh- he's been listening to the show. He says, "Ricky, your show is appalling-"
Um- "Are you actually aware you're on the radio or has someone just secretly stuck a microphone on you?" That's from Richard Anderson.
That's typical of the kind of feedback, Rick, we're getting.
So that's- that's the kind of- yeah, high positive praise that we're getting so uh-
I'm going- I'm plan down cause I wanted him-
I was- I was gunning for him as a fan.
-early on in our career, so uh I think- I think he's hooked now though.
He's sitting through though for Hellraiser, isn't he?
Yeah, well that's still to come.
Uh- a bit of Ol' Dirty… bleh I can't- I can't say the word it's offensive. Old- ODB
Is it bollocks? Is it Ol' Dirty Bollocks?
No no no no no no no… Ol' Dirty…
What is it? What is it?
Old Dirty Bastard - Baby I Gotcha Money
What other funny words are there?
Oh though, Xfm's a funny word and I just say the letters out 'cause the word doesn't make sense.
Just uh- lemme just check Richard Anderson's email again, just remind myself of…
Uh- "Ricky, your show is appalling." Richard Anderson, thanks. What I like about uh- Dicky- Dicky Anders is that he's obviously so angry, he's so annoyed by the show…
… that he's bothered to email just to get the venom out. Cause otherwise he'd just switch over. He's obviously so annoyed he's started up the computer…
He knows how to- he knows how to hurt someone as well.
… and logged on. Exactly, he's really taken the time out to um- to show his disapproval.
Cause I'm thinking of giving up.
I'll tell you what though, it can- it is pretty hard to listen to.
I've listened back to the tape that- when you were making that thing for the Best of…
…and I- I mean I sounded like Albert Tatlock. I s- I really sounded like some sort of punch drunk stroke victim. And- uh- oh there you go. Let's just say I don't remember myself like that.
Um- so uh- yeah, I do apologize. It's- it's not a great planned show slick word of articulate.
Is it? But I mean then who is?

But I think there's so many shows that are, you know, nowadays on radio and I think there's- there's a lot of stuff that's heavily formatted, you know, and there's well- you know- I don't know, presenters who are professional and got some sort of degree of talent.
And ability to sort of sting a sentence together.
You know I'm thinking Chris Moyles.
Yeah. But I mean I'm bored with those- those people who-
-you know, uh- I think we need a little bit of- a little bit of Karl.
